content: eight crafters welcome back to the second part of our spooky tree vid so
this vid we're going to finish up the trees and then we'll look at him on the
table so let's go to that table and finish up those trees
hey guys just like our haunted ritual location I've made some pencil shavings
slurry and it's got white glue and pencil shavings 50% water 50% white glue
now here's my tree I spray painted it black and then painted it with a dark
brown a burnt umber now I'm going to apply this mix to the tree and the goal
is to have some dead vegetation at the base so I'll just scoop that on with my
stiff brush and spray it around the base a bit and I want to get a nice look to
this this will help enhance the deadness of the tree so I'll just let that dry
now it's dried you can almost not see it because the the glue almost disappears
so I'm gonna use a dark brown and fill in those areas that I put the the slurry
on the flocking slurry and we'll let that drive for a minute okay now we're
back I want to paint the tree and I using a grey for the tree and let's
start painting the trunk and you can see that detail starting to pop out that all
that time we spent on detail really paid off and make sure you get the branch
extremities and the trunk and all that kind of thing so now I'm going to use a
Mississippi mud and this will help enhance a sickly look of the tree and
was dry brush that on and there we go nice look okay I want to add another
detail I'm use this light green and kind of be kind of like a glowing moss or
something that we had like if the location of the haunted location so I'll
just start stippling out on the trunk and it really sticks out because it's
that lighter much lighter than the tree so just pop some that on there looking
good now I want to paint the dead grass let me use a tan color and solid just
drying would get my dry brush ready and then just start dry brushing the dead
grass on the bottom of the tree and I think that'll really enhance the look of
the deadness of the tree there we go now let's go the table and take a closer
look at this and the set here's our ritual location in all its
glory with the lighting effects and the deep shadows and everything it really
looks cool let's hit the lights so we can take a closer look okay so we'll get
one of our trees a miniature for scale there bring it closer look at the detail
in that trunk I think it really came out nice with the hot glue detail on there
and the base the the roots look really great that technique is super easy for
making some really cool roots and the dead grass really adds to the tree now
the top here you can see the detail I really like that tree kind of lurching
over the location itself looks like it's dragging for the location I really like
that really think that's cool alright there you go an easy way to make dead
trees onto dead trees and here is another aversion it's a smaller one I
just did the same technique I didn't make the bigger branches I just used the
plastic plants as branches so that's another way that you can have some
smaller trees also there we go our haunted location trees hay crackers I
